Pre-Game Insights: Southgate has first-hand experience of the odd relationship between the fervent intensity that surrounds European Championships and the nostalgic way in which time heals many soccer sins.
England's Euro 2024 campaign is regarded as a seminal summer that helped the country fall back in love with its national team despite initial poor performances.
England meets Switzerland in Saturday's quarterfinal in Dusseldorf.
The winner of that game will take on either the Netherlands, Romania, Austria or Turkey in the semifinal.
England has a tough team to prepare for, so Southgate is already focusing on the upcoming match.
Post-Match Reflections: Southgate's methods and tactics have come under fire, including doubts from public and press, and cups thrown at him by angry supporters, which is proving to be a motivating point for the players.
Rice stated that the team would do anything to protect Southgate and keep fighting.
England's squad spent Monday back at their base, welcoming family members for visits, and had a light session on Tuesday.
Miscellaneous Highlights: England's first game against Switzerland resulted in a 'bang average' performance.
England's first game against Scotland ended with David Seaman saving a penalty while leading 1-0, followed by Paul Gascoigne adding a second goal.
England needed David Platt's last-minute extra-time winner against Belgium and a come-from-behind win against Cameroon to make it to the semifinals in 2000.
England lost to Germany in the semifinals of the 2000 Euro tournament.
